Job Title: Sr. Financial Reporting Analyst

Location: Parsippany, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Location: Parsippany

Company Description

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 40,000 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

About the Role:

This position ensures implementation and coordination of financial and administrative processes of the Company in accordance with local legislation and Global policies. The position will support financial reporting and control over Commercial activities which will include administration activities related to the general ledger, financial statements and audits.

This position reports directly to the Financial Statement and Reporting Director. The position is instrumental in helping with monthly and year-end reporting.

Main Responsibilities:

 Ensure and perform proper closing timelines for fiscal activities and quantitative analysis of financial data External and Internal Audit coordination and execution Make recommendations and implement necessary changes with policies and procedures to support accounting methodologies and compliance objectives Ensure documentation to maintain corporate governance requirements and records Reconciliation of information between systems related to SAP and Hyperion data management Provide support to ad-hoc projects as needed

Who we are looking for:

 At least 4 years of relevant experience Knowledge of financial and management accounting Knowledge of US GAAP (IFRS knowledge encouraged) Knowledge of ERP and reporting systems Ability to enforce administrative financial control systems, policies and procedures while driving process improvement initiatives Detail oriented, problem solver who can work in a fast-paced environment

How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:

Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

Diversity Statement

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

Ferrero N.A. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

#FNA

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
